info.title: P8 API Documentation
info.description:
## API

The API of the trading platform is a set of REST and web socket based services provided via two service end-points, one for administrative API calls, and one for business functionality for regular users.

### Administrative API

The administrative API is available at `https://<base-admin-uri>/api/v1/*`. API calls on this end-point should only be invoked with credentials with administrarive privileges.

### Trading API
The trading API is available at `https://<base-uri>/api/v1/*`. API calls on this end-point should be invoked with credentials of a regular trading user.

## Authentication

All invocations of the REST API (including both administrative and trading) must provide user credentials in the form of a bearer JWT token in the `Authorization` header.

The only exception to this requirement is the call to the `https://<base-uri>/api/v1/get-token` service, which in turn issues an authorization token when valid user credentials are presented.

> Note that the service end-point to use for authentication is based on `http://<base-uri>/` for both administrative and trading users. Invoking using the `<base-admin-uri>` would result in failures.

### Request
```
{
  "username": <username of the user>,
  "password": <password of the user>,
  "type": <type of the user, must be ADMIN or TRADER>
}
```

### Response
```
{
  "accessToken": <access privelege token>,
  "idToken": <authorization token, which should be used as the bearer token in all subsequent calls>
}
```

In addition, the same service call can be used for changing user's passwords (either changing the temporary password assigned when the user account was created before performing the first login, or when a subsequent password change is required). In either case the new password should be specified in the `newPassword` attribute in the request body in addition to current credentials.

### Request
```
{
  "username": <username of the user>,
  "password": <current password of the user>,
  "type": <type of the user, must be ADMIN or TRADER>,
  "newPassword": <new password to be set for the user>
}
```

post.description: Verify OTP by a given verify criteria

/api/v1/order.description: Rest end point to cancel an existing order

401.description: user has no permission to submit new orders

500.description: Server error. Client needs to retry later

200.description: Cancel order accepted by the gateway

401.description: The user does not have permission to cancel this order

404.description: The given order is not found

/api/v1/trade.description: Rest end point to cancel an existing trade

200.description: Cancel trade accepted by the gateway

401.description: The user does not have permission to cancel this trade

404.description: The given order is not found

/api/v1/orderStatus/{userId}.description: Rest end point to download order history

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: user who is requesting order history

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: query symbol, if not specified all symbols will be delivered

parameters.name: activeOrders
parameters.description: order type active/inactive. default value is active

parameters.name: orderId
parameters.description: order id, if not specified no any filter is applied for order id

parameters.name: historyLimit
parameters.description: history limit, if not specified full list will be sent. If you need only latest one, need to set 1 for this field. Mentioned count will be sent from the head always

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: limit value of keys. default value is 500

200.description: Expected response to a valid request

/api/v1/ownTrades/{userId}.summary: api for trade execution report history service
/api/v1/ownTrades/{userId}.description: Rest end point to download trade execution reports

parameters.name: userId
parameters.description: user who is requesting order history

parameters.name: symbol
parameters.description: query symbol, if not specified all symbols will be delivered

parameters.name: limit
parameters.description: limit value of keys. default value is 500

/api/v1/position/trader/balance.description: Get position balance of requested user

500.description: System error. User needs to retry later

get.summary: Get position balance for the user

200.description: Mass order cancel request accepted by the system.

post.summary: Submit mass order cancel to the system

Leverage will be set per position per trader.

post.description: Change margin amount of a crypto futures position

orderQty.description: Order quantity. Must be an integer

price.description: Order price. This should be an integer with implicit decimal places which is defined per instrument

clOrderId.description: Client order id. This should be a unique string of < 15 alpha numeric characters

userId.description: Userid given by exchange. The order is owned by this user

leavesQty.description: Currently open qty of the order

price.description: Order price. This should be an integer with implicit decimal places which is defined per instrument

userId.description: Userid given by exchange. The order is owned by this user

orderId.description: Unique identifier assigned ot the order by the Matching Engine

clOrderId.description: Client order id. This should be a unique string of < 15 alpha numeric characters

origClOrderId.description: Original client order id of the order affected (if it is different to the clOrderId)

execType.description: The reason for this execution report generation

execId.description: unique id for this execution report

rejectReason.description: Why this order was rejected, expired or cancelled

execSize.description: Executed Size. Only filled when execType='F'

execPrice.description: Executed Price. Only populated when execType='F'

Response.title: Root Type for genericMessage
Response.description: This message is used to convey reasons for rejections and other exception conditions

requestId.description: client order id /Request id of the request message. For order message this will contain the client order id

orderId.description: Order id of the order to be cancelled. Either Order Id or the original client order id can be used for cancellation. if orderId is present, the original client orderId is ignore

userId.description: User identification of the owner of the order

origClOrderID.description: Original client order id of the order. This is only used when orderId is not present

tradeId.description: Trade id of the trade to be cancelled.

userId.description: User identification of the owner of the order

tradeId.description: Trade id of the trade to be cancelled.

dummyField.description: Some fields that may need to send

requestId.description: User's unique identifier of the request
User's unique identifier of the request

firmId.description: Firm identifier of the mass cancel to be applied

submitterId.description: Submitter identifier of the mass cancel to be applied

marketId.description: Market identifier of the mass cancel to be applied

IndicationCancelRequest.title: Root Type for IndicationCancelRequest
IndicationCancelRequest.description: Request message to cancel a single indication

quoteResponseId.description: Identifier of Quote Response the dealer is responding to.

status.description: Execution response status. ACCEPT or REJECT

AdminDepositRequest.title: Root Type for AdminDepositRequest
AdminDepositRequest.description: Request message used by admin to deposit funds to an account

AdminWithdrawRequest.title: Root Type for AdminWithdrawRequest
AdminWithdrawRequest.description: Request message used by admin to withdraw funds from an account

amount.description: Withdraw amount. Should be a positive value

AdminPositionAdjustmentRequest.title: Root Type for AdminPositionAdjustmentRequest
AdminPositionAdjustmentRequest.description: Request message used by admin to adjust position balance

clOrderId.description: New client order ID for the request

TraderTransferRequest.title: Root Type for AdminDepositRequest
TraderTransferRequest.description: Request message used by trader to transfer funds between accounts

orderId.description: Order id of the order to be cancelled. Either Order Id or the original client order id can be used for cancellation. if orderId is present, the original client orderId is ignore

userId.description: User identification of the owner of the order

origClOrderID.description: Original client order id of the order. This is only used when orderId is not present

requestId.description: User's unique identifier of the request

firmId.description: Firm identifier of the mass cancel to be applied

marketId.description: Market identifier of the mass cancel to be applied

FuturesSetLeverage.title: Root Type for SetLeverage
FuturesSetLeverage.description: Leverage will be set per position per trader.

amount.description: Amount to be changed. Can be positive or negative value.
